page.title: 04ECOLOGY,RAINFALL
page.content: Because of the importance of CRAY RESERVOIR, the dam of which lies within this area,a series of rainfall measurements have been maintained continuously since the first decade of the century. These are both reliable and of long duration.Annual rainfall totals decrease from 2150 millimetres near the head of the reservoir to 1959 mm beside the dam. Associated with these records are the rain gauge measurements formerly made at Crai Post Office at the height of 283 metres. Here the total is 1803 mm indicating the rapid decrease in the amount of rainfall in the rain shadow north of the mountains. As elsewhere in this part of Wales the wettest months are usually November and December.
